Package fr.cnrs.iees.graph

Interface TreeNode

All Superinterfaces:
Connected<Node>, Element, Identity, Node, Specialized, fr.ens.biologie.generic.Textable
All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleDataTreeNode, SimpleReadOnlyDataTreeNode, SimpleTreeNode, TreeGraphDataNode, TreeGraphNode, TreeGraphReadOnlyDataNode
public interface TreeNode extends Node
The node interface to use in Trees.
Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 17 ao√ªt 2021

  • Method Details

    • getParent

      TreeNode getParent()
      Gets the parent node. Returns null if this is the tree root.
      Returns:
      the parent of this node

    • connectParent

      void connectParent​(TreeNode parent)
      Set the argument as this node's parent. CAUTION: no consistency checks! this is the tree's job (cf Tree.onParentChanged()).
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent node

    • getChildren

      Collection<? extends TreeNode> getChildren()
      Gets the children nodes.
      Returns:
      an immutable collection of children nodes.

    • connectChild

      void connectChild​(TreeNode child)
      Adds a node as a child. CAUTION: no consistency checks! this is the tree's job (cf Tree.onParentChanged()).
      Parameters:
      child - the node to add

    • connectChildren

      default void connectChildren​(TreeNode... children)
      Adds nodes as children
      Parameters:
      children - the nodes to add

    • connectChildren

      default void connectChildren​(Collection<? extends TreeNode> children)
      Adds a set of nodes as children.
      Parameters:
      children - the nodes to add

    • hasChildren

      boolean hasChildren()
      Test if this instance is a leaf node.
      Returns:
      true if this node has children

    • nChildren

      int nChildren()
      Get the number of children of this node.
      Returns:
      the number of child nodes

    • subTree

      default Collection<? extends TreeNode> subTree()
      Get all the sub-tree starting at this instance.
      Returns:
      the subtree starting at this node (=this node + all its children's children)
